result.execSummary:
The defendant Tina M. Zimmermann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Evidence to be destroyed after appeal time has expired.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tina M. Zimmermann

defendant.name: Zimmermann, Tina M.
defendant.address: C/o Price County Jail, 611 Flambeau Ave., Phillips, WI 54555

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:00 am - 12CF45 (SEHR), 15CF24, 15CF31 - Defendant Tina M. Zimmermann in court with attorney Thomas G. Wilmouth.  Defendant in custody.   Mark T. Fuhr appeared for State of WI. Parties have received and reviewed revocation packet.  DA states agreement. Response by Atty. Wilmouth. DE pleads GUILTY to 15CF31.   Court questions DE regarding the plea, plea questionnaire and elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC in 15CF31. Court orders dismissal of enhancers in 15CF31 and dismisses 15CF24. Comments by Atty. Wilmouth. Comments by DE. Comments and ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Adj. 11:23 am. 

12CF45 (Ct. 2) - 3 year prison term consisting of 1 year initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision, cc to Ct. 4, cs to any other sentence with 79 days credit for time served, Eligible for all programming; reimpose all prior monetary obligations.
12CF45 (Ct. 4) - 3 year prision term consisting of 1 year initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision, cc to Ct. 2, cs to any other sentence; reimpose all prior monetary obligations.

15CF31 - 4 year prison term consisting of 1 year initial confinement and 3 years of extended supervision, cs to any other sentence. $268 court costs; $250 DNAAS; $65 SBDA; Evidence to be destroyed after appeal time has expired.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: see minutes on today's date under waiver of preliminary hearing event

2:18 pm - 15CF31 & 15CF24 - Defendant Tina M. Zimmermann appeared with attorney Thomas G. Wilmouth.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions DE regarding waiver of preliminary hearing forms. DE waives preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver. Parties have received and reviewed informations and waive readings. DE pleads NOT GUILTY to all charges. Adj. 2:20 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Tina M. Zimmermann
Current: C/o Price County Jail, 611 Flambeau Ave., Phillips, WI 54555   (Effective: 05-18-2015)
Prior: C/o Price County Jail, Phillips, WI 54555
for discovery and inspection and certificate of service

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

15CF24 & 15CF31 - Defendant Tina M. Zimmermann in court with attorney Thomas G. Wilmouth.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaints acknowledged, reading waived.   Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived each case.   Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Amend by adding 15CF31 to 15CF24 signature bond.
